handwriting.utils.training_utils.classification_loss(e_truth, e_logit)[source]¶

Compute binary cross entropy with logits between target and output logits

Parameters:
  • e_truth (Variable) – target eos
  • e_logit (Variable) – predicted logits
Returns:

the binary cross entropy loss
Return type:

classification_loss (Variable)
handwriting.utils.training_utils.compute_Z(X1, X2, mu1, mu2, log_sigma1, log_sigma2, rho)[source]¶

Compute the z quantity of Formula 25 from https://arxiv.org/pdf/1308.0850.pdf

Parameters:
  • X1 (Variable or Tensor) – specify where to evaluate 2D gaussian
  • X2 (Variable or Tensor) – specify where to evaluate 2D gaussian
  • mu1 (Variable or Tensor) – mean the first gaussian component
  • mu2 (Variable or Tensor) – mean the second gaussian component
  • log_sigma1 (Variable or Tensor) – log standard deviation of the first gaussian component
  • log_sigma2 (Variable or Tensor) – log standard deviation of the second gaussian component
  • rho (Variable or Tensor) – captures the correlation between the gaussian components
Returns:

the computed Z
Return type:

Z (Variable or Tensor)
handwriting.utils.training_utils.gaussian_2Dnll(X1, X2, mdnparams)[source]¶

Compute 2D gaussian negative log-likelihood

Parameters:
  • X1 (Variable) – the first component of the target stroke
  • X2 (Variable) – the second component of the target stroke
  • mdnparams (namedtuple) – holds the predicted Mixture Gaussian parameters
Returns:

the computed 2D gaussian negative log-likelihood
Return type:

nll (Variable)
handwriting.utils.training_utils.get_model(settings, input_dim, output_dim, onehot_dim=None)[source]¶

Utility for model loading

Parameters:
  • settings (ExperimentSettings) – custom class to hold hyperparams
  • input_dim (int) – the last dimension of a (seq_len, batch_size, input_dim) input
  • output_dim (int) – the last dimension of a (seq_len, batch_size, output_dim) output
  • onehot_dim (int) – text one hot encoding dimension (=vocabulary size)
Returns:

a custom pytorch RNN model
Return type:

rnn (nn.Model)

handwriting.utils.training_utils.load_data(settings, data_path='data/raw', validate=False)[source]¶
Load data to train RNN for handwriting generation
Shuffle the data and split between training and validation
Parameters:
  • settings (ExperimentSettings) – custom class to hold hyperparams
  • data_path (str) – path to data
  • validate (bool) – whether we are in validation mode. This is used
  • add the char to idx and idx to char mappings to settings. (to) –
Returns:

custom class holding the data
Return type:

data_container (DataContainer)
handwriting.utils.training_utils.logsumexp(x)[source]¶

Logsumexp trick to avoid overflow in a log of sum of exponential expression

Parameters:x (Variable or Tensor) – the input on which to compute the log of sum of exponential
Returns:the computed log of sum of exponential
Return type:logsum (Variable or Tensor)
handwriting.utils.training_utils.process_text_data(settings, texts)[source]¶

Process text data for conditional generation

Strategy : replace all non literal characters by a dummy # token. One hot encode the str text on a character basis for conditional generation Keep a dictionary to convert onehot to str and vice versa

Parameters:
  • settings (ExperimentSettings) – custom class to hold hyperparams
  • texts (list) – the sequences in str format
Returns:

custom class to hold hyperparams texts (list): the sequences in str format texts_one_hot (list): the sequences, onehot encoded
Return type:

settings (ExperimentSettings)
handwriting.utils.training_utils.train_step(settings, rnn, X_var, Y_var, optimizer, onehot=None)[source]¶

Full training step (forward + backward pass + weight update)

Strategy: Carry out forward pass Compute the gaussian NLL loss and the classification (bce) loss Normalize loss by batch size Store loss in a dict to monitor progress Backward pass Clip gradients by a pre-specified threshold and carry out Weight update

Parameters:
  • settings (ExperimentSettings) – custom class to hold hyperparams
  • rnn (nn.Model) – the model to train
  • Y_var (X_var,) – the
  • optimizer (torch.optimizer) – the optimizer to train the rnn
  • onehot (torch.Variable or None) – the onehot encode text for conditional generation
Returns:

python dictionary storing training metrics
Return type:

d_loss (dict)
